text.content:
You'll notice some changes to the Pathfinder system with this update. With the release of Rage of Elements we also received our first preview of the Pathfinder remastered rules. These changes are mostly in how things are named, with no mechanical impact. For example, you'll notice that the "Flat-Footed" condition is now renamed to "Off-Guard". You can read more of these changes in the Pathfinder Core Preview Document. If you are unaware of the motivation for these changes, it was prompted by the need to remove terminology from the game used by a different company's game system.

We want to make moving to the remastered version as smooth as possible for users, and for most groups these changes will have no impact. The new rules are compatible with the old rules, and all outward appearances are that this is mostly a renaming of items. The mechanical changes will not be integrated into the system until we have guidance on how to implement them with no interruption to gameplay. Going forward we plan to follow direction from Paizo and treat the remastered rules as errata to the game. We do not plan on removing any NPCs from the system, though in the future some names may change. There is no need to worry about something simply vanishing entirely on you or your group. We're players and GMs too, and we understand that some groups may be averse to changes, even ones that are just terminology changes.

We have added the new spells found in the preview document, including renaming some existing spells. If the mechanics of the spell changed in a way that it was not clear if it was meant as a replacement for an existing spell, then we kept the original spell as well as the spell intended to fill a similar function. For example, the Ignition spell is a new fire cantrip but because the mechanics of that cantrip are different than Produce Flame and the Psychic class interacts with the mechanics of produce flame directly, both spells have been kept in the system. But the new spell Falling Stars is a direct mechanical replacement for Meteor Swarm. Compendium entries of Meteor Swarm were renamed, and the mechanics of that spell updated to Falling Stars. Existing links to Meteor Swarm will now point to Falling Stars, but copies of the spell on actors were not removed or altered. For ease of reference here is a list of all spells that have had their names changed:

  • Barkskin is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oaken Resilience].
  • Burning Hands is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Breathe Fire].
  • Calm Emotions is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Calm].
  • Comprehend Languages is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Translate].
  • Dimension Door is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Translocate].
  • Dimensional Lock is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Planar Seal].
  • Endure Elements is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Environmental Endurance].
  • Entangle is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Entangling Flora].
  • Flesh to Stone is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Petrify].
  • Gaseous Form is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Vapor Form].
  • Gentle Repose is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Peaceful Rest].
  • Know Direction is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Know the Way].
  • Longstrider is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Tailwind].
  • Mage Armor is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mystic Armor].
  • Mage Hand is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Telekinetic Hand].
  • Magic Fang is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Runic Body].
  • Magic Weapon is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Runic Weapon].
  • Magnificent Mansion is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Planar Palace]
  • Meld into Stone is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.One with Stone].
  • Meteor Swarm is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Falling Stars].
  • Nondetection is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Veil of Privacy]
  • Obscuring Mist is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mist]
  • Plane Shift is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Interplanar Teleport].
  • Purify Food and Drink is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Cleanse Cuisine].
  • Scorching Ray is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Blazing Bolt].
  • See Invisibility is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.See the Unseen].
  • Stoneskin is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mountain Resilience].
  • Tanglefoot is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Tangle Vine].
  • Tongues is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Truespeech].
  • Tree Shape is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.One with Plants].
  • Tree Stride is now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Nature's Pathway].

Some spells have had their mechanics or text updated with no change to the name:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Augury]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Detect Magic]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Fire Shield]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Invoke Spirits]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Speak with Animals]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Speak with Plants]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Speak with Stones]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wish]

You can also find the following new remaster spells in our compendiums. These are either entirely new spells, or new takes on old spells that have mechanical changes that are not clearly intended as a complete replacement, or the equivalent spell was kept in the system for other mechanical reasons.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Collective Memories]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Figment]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Frostbite]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Howling Blizzard]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ignition]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Liminal Doorway]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Manifestation]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mirage]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Phantasmagoria]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Revealing Light]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Thunderstrike]
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wrathful Storm]

Finally, some languages have been renamed.

  • Aquan is now Thalassic.
  • Auran is now Sussuran.
  • Ignan is now Pyric.
  • Sylvan is now Fey.
  • Terran is now Petran.
